result.execSummary:
The defendant Dewon Lamont Watkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges.  DOC shall collect up to 25% of prison funds. Any remaining portion to be paid during the period of Extended Supervision.  Court orders any unpaid amount converted to a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two.  Credit for 165 days.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; also that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one.  **12/7/2015  Honorable Frederick C. Rosa-165 days credit.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dewon Lamont Watkins

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
**JUDGE POCAN FOR JUDGE ROSA**
- signed and filed.  
IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by Department of Corrections Records Office staff member and will be based upon actual release date. 
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect the defendant's release within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.
Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and forwarded to Br. 35, Judge Rosa for review.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 35, Judge Rosa. aj
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt:
Certification of GUILTY PLEA / SENTENCING HEARING transcript commencing OCTOBER 28, 2015, received and filed. (29 Pages)
Copy of transcript forwarded to:  INSTITUTION
Count two.

- amending judgment of conviction, signed and filed. 
COURT ORDERS: The judgment of convition shall be amended to include 165 days of sentence credit on count two.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Frederick C. Rosa, Br. 35, for review. mag
DOC request to review order for sentence credit.
Count one.
Count two.
Associated with Charge #2

Defendant Dewon Lamont Watkins in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Defendant Dewon Lamont Watkins in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statements made as to sentencing.  

AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS CONCURRENT TO COUNT 2, with credit for 165 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

AS TO COUNT 2: The Court sentenced the defendant to 120 days CONCURRENT to COUNT 1. 
The Court ordered the defendant's operating privileges suspended for 12 MONTHS.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges. 
As to all costs and surcharges, DOC shall collect up to 25% of prison funds. Any remanining portion to be paid during the period of extended supervision. Court orders any unpaid amount converted to a civil judgment. 
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 

Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Letter submitted by Defense (undated).

Attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner in court, defendant Dewon Lamont Watkins not in court, in custody.  
Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Jury Trial.  Parties no longer in contest (trial) posture; plea forms submitted.

AS TO COUNT 2:  On oral motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to POSSESSION OF THC, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 961.41(3g)(e), a Misdemeanor.

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO COUNT 1 AND COUNT 2 (AS AMENDED):  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  

AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Defendant's motion to compel discovery, filed.

Defendant Dewon Lamont Watkins in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Defendant Dewon Lamont Watkins in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court holds conference with counsel in chambers off the record.  Disc of statement has not been turned over, Court makes record.  State to turn over statement forthwith.  Matter to remain scheduled for jury trial on 10/28/15 at 9:30am in Br. 35.

Attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner in court, defendant Dewon Lamont Watkins not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for final pretrial on 10.16.15 and for jury trial on 10.28.15.    All parties notified as of August 03, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35, in room 629 of the courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 10-16-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner in court, defendant Dewon Lamont Watkins not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.
Defendant's Motion for Reduction of Bail.

Attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner in court, defendant Dewon Lamont Watkins not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 7.  Plea hearing scheduled for 07-21-2015 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Dewon Lamont Watkins in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Defendant Dewon Lamont Watkins in custody.  Nathaniel Adamson for Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 07.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.    
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Dewon Lamont Watkins in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Dewon Lamont Watkins in custody.  
David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
